title: Off-duty Dallas cop accidentally shoots his adult son in the arm after mistaking him for an intruder
text:
An off-duty Texas cop shot his own son after mistaking him for an intruder.

The officer, identified only as a 'long-term veteran' of the Dallas Police Department, arrived at his home in DeSoto on Saturday evening and feared someone had broken in because the garage door was open.

He identified himself as law enforcement before opening fire on the 'intruder', who turned out to be his son.

DeSoto police spokesman Pete Schulte said the officer then called 911 and reported that he'd accidentally shot his son.

The victim, who is in his 20s but was not named, was 'lightly struck by a bullet in his arm' and hospitalized.

Scroll down for video

An off-duty Dallas police officer accidentally shot his own son after mistaking him for an intruder at his home in DeSoto on Saturday night. Officers are pictured at the scene

Schulte said the investigation is ongoing but the shooter will likely not face charges as his account was consistent with evidence at the home.

'It was a mistake. He thought that there might have been an intruder in the house,' he told CBS DFW at the scene.

'He didn't know who was supposed to be there and so forth. It was a startling situation, it was an accident.'

The spokesman added: 'We did ask the question: "Why didn't you call us, the DeSoto Police Department?" and like most people say is like: "I just wanted to know what was going on before I wasted a call to 911."'

Schulte said the department wanted the incident to serve as a warning to the public.

'If you come home and something doesn't feel right, [it] doesn't bother us at all, go ahead and call 911, so we can come out and check it out,' he said.
description: The officer, who has not been named, arrived at his home in DeSoto, Texas, on Saturday evening and feared someone had broken in because the garage door was open.
